column2: JOB DESCRIPTION   We are seeking a dynamic and experienced professional to join our team as the Director of Analyst Relations. This role will be based in Bangalore, India, and will be pivotal in shaping and executing our Analyst Relations strategy, playing a key role in strengthening Emids??market recognition, growing analyst advocacy of our organization, and maximizing the value of Analyst Relations wins and intelligence internally.   Accountabilities and Responsibilities:     Strengthen Market Recognition:     Develop and execute strategies to enhance Emids' visibility and recognition within the healthcare and life sciences sector, including collaboration with organization Subject Matter Experts to create Thought Leadership.   Foster relationships with industry analysts to ensure comprehensive coverage and positive visibility.       Grow Analyst Advocacy:     Cultivate strong relationships with key industry analysts, influencers, and thought leaders.   Work collaboratively with internal teams to gather relevant information and insights for analysts.   Strategize and implement initiatives to drive positive analyst advocacy.       Maximize Value of Analyst Relations Wins and Intelligence Internally:     Measure and report impact of Analyst Relations activities.   Leverage analyst insights to enhance internal understanding of market trends and competitive positioning.   Work closely with internal stakeholders to disseminate key analyst feedback and recommendations.   Drive the integration of analyst insights into marketing, sales, and delivery strategies.   Educate internal stakeholders about the importance of analyst relations.   Oversee analyst subscriptions.         Qualifications         Bachelor's degree in a relevant field (e.g., Business, Marketing, Communications).? MBA is a plus.   Minimum of 8-10 years of experience in Analyst Relations or a related field.   Proven track record of successfully managing relationships with executives and industry analysts.   Strong understanding of the healthcare and life sciences IT services sector.   Solid project management skills, with the ability to manage multiple projects simultaneously and meet deadlines.   Excellent communication, presentation, and interpersonal skills.   Strategic thinker with the ability to translate insights into actionable plans.   Proficiency in using tools and platforms for analyst relations management, benchmarking, and reporting is a plus.          Roles and Responsibilities   Director RR/57/2024
column11: analysts, project management, advisory services, data analysis, benchmarking, management skills, analytical, presentation skills, research analysis, interpersonal skills, analysis, analyst relations, sales, healthcare, excel, management, life sciences, reporting, communication skills

column2: Planning, Investor Engagement, and Fund Rise              JOB DESCRIPTION:                   Support the fund-raising activities, investor meets and board reviews             Performing qualitative and quantitative analysis of business MIS, KPIs and benchmarking             Working on Investor communication materials (Board Decks, Investor Presentation, Financial models/Business Plans, etc)             Engaging with various internal and external stakeholders for obtaining inputs, data, information, and co-ordination of work-streams             Contribute to building IR narrative or addressing investor queries Mergers and acquisitions                             Sourcing and evaluation of inorganic opportunities (investments and acquisitions) in collaboration with internal teams; with end-to-end execution of chosen opportunities.             Work with various internal teams in the business to ensure effective integration of an acquisition and monitor post-merger integration/performance Strategic Initiatives             Assist in planning and implementation of key projects and strategic initiatives             Assist in developing long-range corporate plans             Partner with business units to identify and evaluate expansion opportunities (conduct primary and secondary research including evaluation of competitive landscape) and drive business plan development for the same             Convert strategies into action and coordinate/manage the implementation of key strategic projects and initiatives in liaison with cross-functional leadership/business units             Peer tracking and monitoring of industry trends and macro variables driving the industry                   QUALIFICATION AND SKILLS :                 1 to 5 years of experience gained through investment banking, private equity/venture capital investing, management consulting/corporate strategy background - Self-starter who can excel in a fast-paced and fluid environment         Ability to work collaboratively with a variety of internal and external stakeholders, drive cross-functional projects and maintain high ownership         Hands-on experience in financial modelling, business analysis, and competitive bench-marking - Excellent oral and written skills with strong interpersonal skills         Strong research capabilities, thorough analytical abilities, and business acumen                 SUMMARY:               The Fuzi Tech Group of Companies Corporate Development team holds the reins to much of our worldwide growth     As a member of the Corporate Development team, you work collaboratively across functions (including Legal, Finance, Technology, Product and People Operations) to identify and evaluate both acquisition and investment opportunities     - You provide the management team with the needed insight to drive intelligent, sound decision-making     You understand the industry landscape and harness it to manage our deals and integration     With an air of humility, you bring strong quantitative skills, strategic thinking and sound business judgment, along with the ability to think about what is and what could be     The Corporate Development team drives organisations worldwide growth by identifying exciting acquisition and strategic investment opportunities across existing and future markets - and then working to make them happen               Consisting of experienced merger and acquisition leaders, investment professionals, scouting and strategy specialists, and integration experts, Fuzi Tech dedicated to identifying the business opportunities of tomorrow.          Fuzi Tech drive team decisions, lead negotiations, and help run post           acquisition integration and performance evaluation. Responsibilities:      Research industry trends, competitive landscape and internal product development efforts.      Identify, evaluate and value acquisition and strategic investment opportunities in India      Build connections with regional investors and start     up ecosystems.      Help drive management team decisions and support agreement negotiations and execution
column11: Business analysis, MIS, Analytical, Management consulting, Venture capital, Investment banking, Fund raising, Secondary research, Private equity
